normalized: a doorway that linked the demon capital tokyo to the world.
haneda international airport, terminal 3, late at night.
in that place, there was a politician heading for the vip boarding gate at a quick pace, accompanied by two burly, black suit-wearing anglo-saxons.
a body that had grown fat without a bit of self-restraint, arms that moved nervously, and small, sly-looking black eyes which didn't match his stern face.
more distinctive than anything was the fact that the area around his square, angular jaw was covered by a steel plate.
he was yazaki muneichi, ex-chief secretary of the people's new party, a man who reinforced his jaw, which had once been broken due to an “incident”.

name: yazaki
normalized: oi, hold on!
even if we hurry like this, the plane isn't going to run away, is it?!
yazaki yelled, while panting, as if to demonstrate his lack of regular exercise.
the south-facing wall of the long floor that the group was rushing across was covered entirely by a large pane of glass, and one could look out over the whole runway.
a chartered airplane from the american federation government could be seen in the direction yazaki pointed.
opposite yazaki, who had stopped walking, one of the anglo-saxons answered him while keeping alert about their surroundings.
it seemed he was a corporal.

name: corporal
normalized: yazaki-san, our intelligence bureau understands that public safety has gotten wind of your movements.

name: yazaki
normalized: public safety?!
crap!
in that case, wouldn't an american federation base be safer, though?!
what's the meaning of this, master sergeant?!
the other anglo-saxon (who had been called a master sergeant, and was holding a large suitcase) replied,

name: master sergeant
normalized: the taimanin have already spread out around our base.
they are your sworn enemies, correct?

name: yazaki
normalized: taimanin?!
yazaki's face twisted with hatred.
his steel plate creaked, due to his clenched back teeth.

name: yazaki
normalized: those guys are after me?!

name: master sergeant
normalized: it's not just the taimanin, mr.
yazaki.
we also have information that the self-defence forces' special units have been dispatched.

name: master sergeant
normalized: that's how important what you're trying to smuggle out is to japan.
and, of course, to our american federation as well.

name: yazaki
normalized: yeah, i know!
but now it's like i'm running away under the cover of darkness, isn't it?!

name: master sergeant
normalized: yes.
we had been making careful preparations, but there was someone who ignored our warnings and moved money out of their secret bank account.

name: master sergeant
normalized: they were traced from there, and our plan was detected as a result.
the master sergeant said, courteously.
his face said that he knew who had moved the money.

name: yazaki
normalized: guh… i, i get it!
hurry up!
yazaki raised a loud voice in order to gloss over his mistake, and began to walk again, as if forcing his fat body along.

yazaki muneichi had served as a member of the upper house of the diet for 8 terms, and dominated the political world as the leading figure of his party, but was also an underworld fixer linked to the chinese union (who planned to expand into japan), and had control over dealings between men and demons.
he was in the miserable situation of being exiled from the country as if he were fleeing in the night.

name: yazaki
normalized: shit!
those ninja!
the causes of his downfall were an election, and the taimanin.
while he schemed to shut down the obnoxious taimanin one way or another, his secret feud with them had intensified.
his party, who had come just short of driving the taimanin to the wall with the might of their administration, had suffered a huge defeat in the general election.
and when they fell from power, the situation had completely changed, and the taimanin had gone on a counter-offensive.

the underground organizations under yazaki's control had received crushing blows one after another because of the taimanin, and his influence in the political world had declined in proportion to that.
once that happened, the authorities had finally started to make their move on the weakened yazaki, and he had decided to flee the country once the investigation finally extended to him.
of course, few countries would accept asylum for a problem child like yazaki.
ordinarily, something like asylum would have been impossible.
even though he had amassed a large amount of illegally-obtained money, his hopes were slim.

therefore, yazaki had formulated a plan to seek asylum in the american federation, bringing the gift of special a-class secret information related to the technology of hell, which he had learned about during his time in office.
it was something desperately wanted by the american federation, which had fallen a step or two behind in the arms race over technology related to hell.
even if their relationship with japan would deteriorate.
in short, the couple of anglo-saxons who were guarding and escorting yazaki were agents of the american government.

their position was that of staff members in the american federation state department, but, based on the clanking noises that were sometimes heard, there was no doubt that they were dangerous agents who had been partially converted into cyborgs.

name: yazaki
normalized: （the taimanin!
asagi!
those little girls, yukikaze and rinko!
i'll definitely get revenge!

the cause of the leaks in the scandal that had triggered him losing big in the election was yukikaze and rinko, who had secretly manoeuvred under the directions of asagi, the taimanin's loathsome commanding officer.
they attacked me first, so i resent them for that.
yazaki had no such thoughts.
they were unforgivable pig bitches, no more than that.

name: yazaki
normalized: （i will definitely make a comeback!
just you watch!
he would sell out anything for the sake of his own continued luxury.
he would sell out his country.
he would sell everything he could sell, and survive.
if he did so, he would definitely have a chance of returning to power―that alone was yazaki's political philosophy.

the fact that his plan (fleeing the country, carrying off the hellish technology that japan tightly controlled) had been uncovered was a blunder, but as long as he weathered this crisis, and he had money saved up, he would definitely be able to return to power―yazaki had confidence in that.

name: yazaki
normalized: （once my exile is successful, i'll have money!
what's wrong with moving my money?!
if he had something that even the american federation wanted that much, then he ought to break as much of a sweat as he pleased.

name: yazaki
normalized: （dimwit cyborgs!
you're all totally unreliable!
yazaki was insulting them in his mind, when those two dimwitted cas, or ＜cyborg agents＞, suddenly halted.

name: yazaki
normalized: what's with you guys?!
you're the ones who told me to hurry, aren't you?!

name: master sergeant
normalized: corporal!

name: corporal
normalized: aye, sir!
the pair ignored yazaki.
the cas, both the master sergeant and corporal, gave off strange noises as they looked around, making what was behind their sunglasses light up in all seven colours.

name: yazaki
normalized: oi!
what are you doing?!
oi!

name: corporal
normalized: master sergeant, taima particles detected!

name: yazaki
normalized: what are you talking about?!
tell me!

name: master sergeant
normalized: shut up, jap!
our mission is to be your escorts, not your babysitters!
the master sergeant's hand firmly grabbed the nape of yazaki's neck.

name: yazaki
normalized: wha?!
what are you doing?
let me go!

name: master sergeant
normalized: get back there!

name: yazaki
normalized: nowawawawah!
yazaki was lifted up by the master sergeant ca as easily as a rubber ball, and roughly hidden behind a pillar.

name: yazaki
normalized: （these piece of junk cyborgs!
yazaki cursed in his mind, but he at least understood that danger was approaching.
on his instincts as a politician who had gotten through a lot of disasters, he curled his fat body up like a mouse, and hid himself.

name: corporal
normalized: master sergeant, they're coming!

name: master sergeant
normalized: i've been looking forward to a fight with the taimanin.
corporal, let's show these japanese ninja our technological might.
show them what modern warfare is!

name: corporal
normalized: aye, sir!

name: yazaki
normalized: （taimanin are coming?!
yazaki felt his testicles tightly shrivel with fear.
the next moment――
countless small bolts of lightning broke out in the quiet airport lobby.
the glass on the south side suddenly broke, and a strong wind swept over them.

name: yazaki
normalized: （no way!
yazaki remembered this sight.
well, he was hardly going to forget.

name: yazaki
normalized: （them?!
and then, an instant flash coloured their surroundings white.
yazaki closed his eyes due to its brightness, and when he opened them,
two women had appeared there.

name: yazaki
normalized: （shiit!
yazaki grit his teeth.
what had appeared were his old enemies―the young taimanin dragon and tiger, mizuki yukikaze and her partner, akiyama rinko.

name: corporal
normalized: it's a spacial leap.
“slasher oni taimanin” rinko akiyama's ability confirmed.

name: master sergeant
normalized: and those two pistols―“lightning strike taimanin” yukikaze mizuki, huh?

name: yazaki
normalized: （are you morons?!
you can tell that by looking!
unrelated to yazaki's unrest, the two cas faced yukikaze and rinko calmly, without even a hint of being perturbed by their sudden paranormal arrival.

name: yukikaze
normalized: rinko-senpai, it looks like we're even famous in the american federation♪

name: rinko
normalized: surely you're not happy or anything?
it looks like they don't feel like obediently handing over that scumbag politician.

name: yukikaze
normalized: yazakii～～, you're here, right?
did you think you could get away from us?

name: rinko
normalized: it's time to pay your dues.
you tremble over there until we take down these guys.

name: yazaki
normalized: hi, hiih!
yazaki started shaking.
the desire for revenge, which he had been brimming with until just before, had disappeared somewhere.

name: yazaki
normalized: （kill them, you pieces of american junk!
anything you do is fine, so kill those guys!
in front of yazaki―who was unable to stand up out of fear, and had started praying―a deathmatch was about to begin.
